G.L. c. 208, \u00a7\u00a7 28, 28A and 31.proposition: This Court has continuing jurisdiction over the parties and the subject matter of this action pursuant to G.L. c. 208, §§ 28, 28A and 31, and G.L. c. 215, § 6, because the prior Judgment regarding custody and parenting time was issued by this Court and the child presently resides in the Commonwealth.

G.L. c. 208, \u00a7 28.proposition: Under G.L. c. 208, § 28, a Probate and Family Court may modify prior judgments concerning custody and visitation upon a showing of a material and substantial change in the circumstances of the parties or the child and where modification is in the child’s best interests.

G.L. c. 208, \u00a7 31.proposition: Under G.L. c. 208, § 31, and the cases cited above, the Court may and should consider the child’s educational needs, each parent’s cooperation with the school, and each parent’s ability and willingness to ensure regular attendance and participation in academic supports, in determining custody and parenting time.
